text:
Personally, I don't really work with writers that need a lot of hand-holding when it comes to topic research so my briefs are more strategic.

Here's how one looks (first three pages) - I took a page from <@U017WRJTKF1> (actually, I swiped the whole damn thing, down to the font :smile: ) and it's working out well so far.

Also, I'd argue that tools are needed but after the fact. I use a couple of tools to look for content gaps/missed KW opportunities after the piece has been ranking for a month or two.

text: Proxima is everything. I just can't go back... it makes even gibberish look good! :smile:

elements.text: Proxima is everything. I just can't go back... it makes even gibberish look good!

text: Indeed, I like it! It made me think of the parallels between content and music — you can have remixes, medleys, covers… :wink:

elements.text: Indeed, I like it! It made me think of the parallels between content and music — you can have remixes, medleys, covers…

text: one thing I noticed, though, <@UJE6FLEFJ> is that your CTA heading still talks about repurposing — is this on purpose? it may be a bit confusing.

text:
Hey folks, wanted to share a thing I’ve been working on for a while at Maze. I’m so happy I got to finally hit publish today :sweat_smile: :blush:

If you or someone you know want to learn more about UX/UI design, I hope this collection might act as a great starting point:  <https://maze.co/collections/ux-ui-design/>

Excited to hear your thoughts!

attachments.title: UX/UI Design | Resources & Inspiration | Maze Collection
attachments.text: Discover our collection of design resources, examples, and best practices.
attachments.fallback: Maze: UX/UI Design | Resources & Inspiration | Maze Collection

text:
Hey All - Today we’re announcing *<http://www.userleap.com|UserLeap's new Integrations Hub on Product Hunt>!*

:question:Almost every week, I see folks in this community asking *how to get quick and easy access to user/customer insights*, and share those insights with their teams (like marketing and customer support) and tools (like Productboard and Gmail). 

:bulb:UserLeap has been helping thousands of product teams, from new startups seeking product market fit to companies with millions of users, *collect and understand user insights in real-time* with UserLeap’s contextual (and in-product) microsurveys.

:tada: *Today we’re introducing over 3,180 new integration possibilities that make it easy to connect real-time user insights with all parts of your business. <http://www.userleap.com|Check us out and tell us what you think by heading over to our website and Product Hunt>!*

We’d appreciate your support and want to hear what you think!

attachments.title: UserLeap | Product & User Research Software
attachments.text: Continuously identify opportunities to acquire and retain more customers. Gain clarity into customer needs and grow your business.
attachments.fallback: UserLeap: UserLeap | Product & User Research Software

elements.text: Hey All - Today we’re announcing
UserLeap's new Integrations Hub on Product Hunt
Almost every week, I see folks in this community asking
how to get quick and easy access to user/customer insights
, and share those insights with their teams (like marketing and customer support) and tools (like Productboard and Gmail).
UserLeap has been helping thousands of product teams, from new startups seeking product market fit to companies with millions of users,
collect and understand user insights in real-time
with UserLeap’s contextual (and in-product) microsurveys.
Today we’re introducing over 3,180 new integration possibilities that make it easy to connect real-time user insights with all parts of your business.
Check us out and tell us what you think by heading over to our website and Product Hunt
We’d appreciate your support and want to hear what you think!

text:
Hey all, the team at <http://knapsack.cloud|Knapsack> launched a <https://www.knapsack.cloud/content/accessibility-report|free report> about how to use design systems to create more accessible and inclusive experiences. It covers:
:bow_and_arrow: How design systems help product teams build accessible products
:eyeglasses: Why everyone on your product team needs to understand accessibility
:hammer: Tools that can help you build more accessible products
:wheelchair: Tips for using your design system to design inclusive experiences
:books: Examples of accessibility-forward public design systems

The report is available for download <https://www.knapsack.cloud/content/accessibility-report|here>.

:yellow_heart: <https://www.producthunt.com/posts/design-system-insights-accessibility|We've also launched on Product Hunt>—if you want to upvote, we'd appreciate it! :yellow_heart:

attachments.title: Design System Insights: Accessibility - Use your design system to build more accessible experiences | Product Hunt
attachments.text: This report is a collection of six insights into how design systems, accessibility, and inclusive design are connected, plus explanations of industry terminology, tips for building a more accessible design system, and recommendations for trustworthy products.
attachments.fallback: Product Hunt: Design System Insights: Accessibility - Use your design system to build more accessible experiences | Product Hunt
